   function loginRadiusLoadEvent(func) {
                    /**
                     * Call functions on window.onload
                     */
                    var oldOnLoad = window.onload;
                    if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
                        window.onload = func;
                    } else {
                        window.onload = function () {
                            oldOnLoad();
                            func();
                        }
                    }
                }
  </script>

a.telephone-link {
  color: #FFF200;
  padding-left: 9px;
}

    @media screen and (min-width: 1350px){
        .ois_inner_wrap_21.container-fluid {
          max-height:320px;
        }
    }

input[type=text],
input[type=email],
input[type=tel],
input[type=url],
input[type=search] {
  appearance: none!important;
  -moz-appearance: none!important;
  -webkit-appearance: none!important;

  border-radius: 0!important;
  -moz-border-radius: 0!important;
  -webkit-border-radius: 0!important;
}

      .header-menu .sub-menu{
        border:none;
        visibility: visible!important;
      }
    .sub-menu li:hover {
      background-color: rgb(49, 191, 73);
    }
      .header #main-menu .header-menu li.current-menu-item a, .header #main-menu .header-menu a:hover {
        background: inherit;
        color: #FFF;
      }
      .sub-menu ul {
        left:100%;
      }
      .sub-menu li{
        background: #1F4380;
        border-left: none;
      }
      .header-menu .sub-menu:before,
      .header-menu .sub-menu:after{
        border-bottom: #1F4380;
      }

    @media screen and (max-width: 920px){
      #menu-top.show_menu{
        max-height: 1111px!important;
      }
      #menu-top &gt; li {
        border-bottom: 1px solid#FFF;
      }
      #menu-top li {
          padding: .5em;
          float: left!important;
      }

      .header #main-menu .header-menu li a {
        border-left:0!important;
      }

      .sub-menu{
        position: relative !important;
        width:100% !important;
        float: left;
        border-left: 5px solid #FFF!important;
        margin-bottom: 1em;
      }

      .sub-menu ul{
        left:0 !important;
      }
      .sfHover ul {
        visibility: visible;
        display: block;
      }
    }

  <script>
   (function($) {

    $(function() {

        "use strict";






        $(document).ready(function() {
     

            // superFish
            $("#menu-top").superfish({
                pathLevels:    2
            }); // call supersubs(deprecated) first, then superfish
     

            var owl = $(".owl-carousel");
            owl.owlCarousel({
                items: 6,
                loop: true,
                margin: 20,
                autoplay: true,
                autoplayTimeout: 5000,
                autoplayHoverPause: false,
                    responsiveClass: true,
                responsive: {
                  0: {
                    items: 1,
                    autoplayTimeout: 2000
                  },
                  600: {
                    items: 3,
                    autoplayTimeout: 2000
                  },
                  1000: {
                    items: 5,
                    autoplayTimeout: 5000,
                    margin: 20
                  },
                  1280: {
                    items: 6,
                    autoplayTimeout: 5000,
                    margin: 20
                  }
                }
            });
        });



    });

})(jQuery, this);
  </script>

   .widget_cc_ctab_widget {

.action-box-item {
  margin:0!important;
  overflow: hidden!important;

/*-ms-transition: all 0.3s ease-out;*/ /* IE10 is actually unprefixed */
/*-o-transition: all 0.3s ease-out;*/
/*transition: all 0.3s ease-out;*/
}

  position: relative;
  min-height: 75px;
  padding: 10px 25px;
}
.action-item-container:hover {
  background-color: rgb(247, 255, 251);
  -moz-border-radius-bottomleft: 10px;
  -webkit-border-bottom-left-radius: 10px;
  border-bottom-left-radius: 10px;
  -moz-border-radius-bottomright: 10px;
  -webkit-border-bottom-right-radius: 10px;
  border-bottom-right-radius: 10px;
}

  background-color: #FFF;

 border-color:#1F4380;
}

  position: absolute;
  top: 45px;
  font-size: 50px;
  font-family: roboto;
  font-weight: 100;
  color: #999;
  text-align: left;
  float: left;
  left: 150px;
}

  <!-- Start Fluid Video Embeds Style Tag -->
  <style type="text/css">
   /* Fluid Video Embeds */
.fve-video-wrapper {
    position: relative;
    overflow: hidden;
    height: 0;
    background-color: transparent;
    padding-bottom: 56.25%;
    margin: 0.5em 0;
}
.fve-video-wrapper iframe,
.fve-video-wrapper object,
.fve-video-wrapper embed {
    position: absolute;
    display: block;
    top: 0;
    left: 0;
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
}
.fve-video-wrapper a.hyperlink-image {
    position: relative;
    display: none;
}
.fve-video-wrapper a.hyperlink-image img {
    position: relative;
    z-index: 2;
    width: 100%;
}
.fve-video-wrapper a.hyperlink-image .fve-play-button {
    position: absolute;
    left: 35%;
    top: 35%;
    right: 35%;
    bottom: 35%;
    z-index: 3;
    background-color: rgba(40, 40, 40, 0.75);
    background-size: 100% 100%;
    border-radius: 10px;
}
.fve-video-wrapper a.hyperlink-image:hover .fve-play-button {
    background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.85);
}
@media screen and (max-device-width: 768px) {
    .fve-video-wrapper iframe, .fve-video-wrapper object, .fve-video-wrapper embed { display: none; }
    .fve-video-wrapper a.hyperlink-image { display: block; }
}
  </style>
  <!-- End Fluid Video Embeds Style Tag -->

   &lt;!--

display: inline-block;
}
.synved-social-resolution-normal {
display: inline-block;
}
.synved-social-resolution-hidef {
display: none;
}

@media only screen and (min--moz-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
only screen and (-o-min-device-pixel-ratio: 2/1),
only screen and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
only screen and (min-device-pixel-ratio: 2),
only screen and (min-resolution: 2dppx),
only screen and (min-resolution: 192dpi) {
	.synved-social-resolution-normal {
	display: none;
	}
	.synved-social-resolution-hidef {
	display: inline-block;
	}
}
  </style>
  <style type="text/css">
   .broken_link, a.broken_link {
	text-decoration: line-through;
}
  </style>
  <script>
   (function(d, s, id) {
  var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
  if (d.getElementById(id)) return;
  js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
  js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_GB/all.js#xfbml=1&amp;appId=129200997206154";
  fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));
  </script>
 </head>
 <body>
  <div id="fb-root">
  </div>
  <script>
   !function(d,s,id){var js,fjs=d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];if(!d.getElementById(id)){js=d.createElement(s);js.id=id;js.src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js";fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js,fjs);}}(document,"script","twitter-wjs");
  </script>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   (function() {

			  })();
  </script>

   (function() {

  <div class="main donate-main">
   <div class="inner inner-homepage">
    <section class="content">
     <article class="post_box entry entry-reg top" id="post-2339">
      <header class="headline-area">
       <h1 class="headline">
        Root Canals and Cancer
       </h1>
       <div class="byline">
        <span class="post_author_intro">
         by
        </span>
        <span class="post_author">
         cwagner@beatcancer.org
        </span>
        <span class="post_date">
         1 year ago
        </span>
        <a class="num_comments_link" href="http://beatcancer.org/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/#comments" rel="nofollow">
         <span class="num_comments">
          22
         </span>
         comments
        </a>
       </div>
      </header>
      <div class="post_content">
       <p>
        <a href="http://beatcancer.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Root-Canals.jpg">
         <img alt="Root Canals" class="alignleft size-full wp-image-4227" height="206" src="http://beatcancer.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Root-Canals.jpg" width="213"/>
        </a>
        By Bill Henderson, Author and Cancer Coach:
       </p>
       <p>
        My latest career is helping people heal their cancers. At 82, this is a wonderful blessing for me. In fact, it is the most fulfilling thing Ive done in my life and Ive done lots of things.After researching cancer for the last 16 years, writing three books and 190 newsletters on natural cancer healing and recording 210 of my How to Live Cancer-Free hour-long radio shows, I feel Ive learned a lot. However, Ive learned the most from talking to over 5,000 people on the phone (all over the world in 66 countries) about their cancers. I feel compelled to get one particular message to you.
        <span id="more-2339">
        </span>
       </p>
       <p>
        Two facts have jumped out at me from those many phone calls. They are simply:
        <b>
         1)
        </b>
        <b>
         The most common
         <a href="http://beatcancer.org/2014/02/what-causes-cervical-cancer-and-how-to-prevent-it-naturally/">
          cause of all cancers
         </a>
         is root canal-filled teeth and cavitation sites; and 2) Until a cancer patient gets rid of the root canal-filled teeth and cavitations, they dont get well.
        </b>
        You can take those two facts to the bank, folks.
       </p>
       <p>
        Why is this the first time youve heard about this (unless youve been reading what Ive written, heard my radio show or talked to me on the phone)? Well, Ill tell you. Doctors know nothing about this. Ive asked each of the 5,000 plus cancer patients Ive talked to on the phone the same question:
        <i>
         Has your cancer doctor ever talked to you about your dental history?
        </i>
        The answer, every time, is
        <i>
         No.
        </i>
        But even more significant, 99.6% of dentists are ignorant of the two facts above about cancer and root canalsor, they are in denial about it, like their dental professional societies, because of the fear of liability. If you knew what I know (and am about to share with you) about root canals and the degenerative conditions they cause, you would be tempted to sue the dentist who did yours, and youd be perfectly justified. Believe me the
        <strong>
         American Dental Association (ADA)
        </strong>
        knows what Im telling you here. They have a large staff of full-time lawyers whose mission apparently is to keep suppressed the connection between dental work and health.
       </p>
       <p>
        A small cadre of dentists has courageously schooled themselves in how to detect and treat root canal problems and cavitations. These are not the mercury-free or holistic dentists you see advertised in the Yellow Pages. In fact, this small group operates under the radar because of the persecution their brave compadres have suffered at the hands of the dental societies and State Dental Boards. I know of 40 or so of these wonderfully qualified and brave dentists. Their names have been given to me by cancer survivors who have taken my advice and addressed their root canal and cavitation problems. These ladies and gentlemen are competent to help you. There are about 15 or so others
        <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
         worldwide
        </span>
        who are capable of dealing with this problem. This number of 55 or so dentists is out of the 160,000 dentists and 7,400 endodontists (root canal specialists) in the U.S. alone.
       </p>
       <p>
        Many people postpone getting their jaw evaluated by one of these competent dentists. It is common to procrastinate on dental work. It is costly, usually not covered by insurance, and often painful. This procrastination or ignorance has cost millions of people their lives. If possible, I want to help you avoid that fate. First, let me explain why I feel this is
        <span style="text-decoration: underline;">
         Priority One
        </span>
        if you have cancer.
       </p>
       <h2>
        Root Canal Facts
       </h2>
       <p>
        Over 40,000,000 (40 million) teeth are saved in the U.S. alone every year by having a root canal done on them. This common name for this treatment is really a misnomer. The root canal in a tooth is the portion in the center of the tooth that goes down into the roots (usually two roots  sometimes three or even four). When a root canal is done by the dentist, he/she removes the nerve in the center of the tooth and the pulp which surrounds it. This nerve and pulp goes all the way down from under the crown of the tooth to the end of the roots in the jaw. This is usually done because the decay has penetrated the center of the tooth and a normal filling is impossible because it would press on the nerve. The root canal process has a reputation for being quite painful and frequently difficult. When the nerve and pulp of the tooth is removed by this procedure, it is replaced with an inert substance  usually the rubber-like gutta percha. The dentist attempts to sterilize the tooth before the gutta percha is inserted in the root canal. The object is to cut off the normal circulation of bacteria through the tooth and make it permanently sterile. Unfortunately, this never works. I say attempts to sterilize the tooth because it has been proven that this is impossible. The tooth becomes a dead piece of bone in the jaw. The bacteria which were in the millions of tiny tubules in the dentin of the tooth (the portion between the enamel and the root canal) mutate into anaerobic bacteria. These are bacteria which do not require oxygen. Every root canal-filled tooth has them. No exceptions. They occur because of the structure of the root canal filling. It is impossible to eliminate them and they are 1,000 times more toxic than any other bacteria. In fact, the toxins they put out are in the form of a gas called thio-ethers which can easily migrate through the enamel of the tooth and down through the roots into the bloodstream. These toxins travel throughout the body, as do many of the bacteria themselves. These are responsible for most chronic degenerative conditionsnot just cancer, but rheumatoid arthritis, heart disease, multiple sclerosis, lupus, ALS, diabetes.you name it.
       </p>
       <p style="text-align: center;">
        [ For more great articles and free gift
        <a href="https://my.leadpages.net/leadbox/1474979f3f72a2%3A100f27406346dc/5715999101812736/" target="_blank">
         Click Here to Subscribe
        </a>
        <script data-config="%7B%7D" data-leadbox="1474979f3f72a2:100f27406346dc" data-url="https://my.leadpages.net/leadbox/1474979f3f72a2%3A100f27406346dc/5715999101812736/" src="//my.leadpages.net/leadbox-901.js" type="text/javascript">
        </script>
        ]
       </p>
       <h3>
        Evidence
       </h3>
       <p>
        The evidence of what Ive told you above is overwhelming. Here are some examples.
       </p>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <strong>
          Dr. Weston Price
         </strong>
         , beginning in 1903, led a study by 60 prominent dentists. Their mission was to find a safe way to perform a root canal filling. In 1923, they submitted their 1,174 pages of research to the American Dental Association (ADA). The teams conclusion: there is no safe way to do a root canal filling. Why, you ask, are 40 million of these done every year in the U.S. 91 years later? And why are they done exactly the same way they were in Dr. Prices time? Well, it is mind boggling, but Ill tell you. A key assumption of Dr. Weston Prices team was something called focal infection. This just means that an infection somewhere in your body (your mouth, for example) can affect organs distant from it. This concept is taught in all medical schools now and has been for many years. At the time, however, it was controversial. The conservative heads of the ADA rejected Dr. Prices teams conclusions because they did not believe in the focal infection concept. Youll find Dr. Prices research summarized in a book called
         <i>
          Root Canal Cover-Up
         </i>
         by Dr. George Meinig, D.D.S., F.A.C.D. Dr. Meinig passed away in 2008. He was a prominent endodontist (root canal specialist). After he retired in 1993 from 50 years of practice, he discovered Dr. Prices 1923 research report. He was horrified when he considered the thousands of people whose health he had ruined in his 50 years of practice by doing root canal fillings. As a
         <i>
          mea culpa,
         </i>
         Dr. Meinig wrote the Root Canal Cover-Up book and spent the last 15 years of his life trying to get his message out to people about how deadly root canal-filled teeth are. Heres what Dr. Hal Huggins (see below) says about Dr. Weston Prices research: 
         <i>
          Dr. Weston Price and Mayos Clinic of 1910 to 1920 described finding bacterial growth in root canals that could be transferred into animals and create the same diseases the donor human had in from 80 to 100% of the animals. Heart disease, in particular, could be transferred 100% of the time. His research has since been suppressed by the various Dental Associations in the United States.
         </i>
         <span style="line-height: 1.5em;">
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <strong>
          Dr. Hal Huggins, D.D.S.
         </strong>
         had his dental license taken away by the ADA in 1993. He had become too vocal and visible on the issue of the deadly nature of mercury amalgam fillings. Dr. Huggins was not particularly concerned. He had already begun his second career of researching dental toxins. He has discovered 82 different types of unique anaerobic bacteria which originate only in the mouth. Autopsies of people who died of heart disease have found 30 of these types of bacteria in the hearts of these people. They could have originated only in the mouth. From 1994 through 2000, Dr. Huggins with Dr. Thomas Levy, a cardiologist M.D., attempted to replicate the research done by Dr. Price but with more sophisticated testing techniques. Dr. Levy told me in 2007 when I interviewed him on my web talk radio show that he and Dr. Huggins had studied over 5,000 recently removed root canal-filled teeth. Every one of them was taken to the lab and tested. Dr. Levy said that every single one had toxins coming out of it more toxic than botulism. Dr. Huggins has trained about 200 dentists on the protocol that should be used to clean up your jaw. He told me in 2010 that he refers people to only six (6) of them. The others, he feels, do not follow his strict protocol adequately. For those on his list near you, you can call his office in Colorado Springs, Colorado (Mountain Time) at (866) 948-4638. You will find several articles by Dr. Huggins on the subject of root canals and other dental toxins at
         <a href="http://www.terfinfo.com/" rel="nofollow" target="blank">
          http://www.terfinfo.com
         </a>
         .
         <span style="line-height: 1.5em;">
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <strong>
          Dr. Josef Issels M.D.
         </strong>
         was a famous German cancer doctor. For 40 years, from 1947 until his retirement in 1987, Dr. Issels treated thousands of cancer patients. He is credited with being a
         <i>
          world renowned pioneer of integrative cancer treatment.
         </i>
         In 1993, he called Dr. Hal Huggins. In his broken English, Dr. Issels complimented Dr. Huggins for picking up the torch and trying to get the message about dental toxins to more people. Dr. Issels said that in his 40 years of treating cancer patients, 97% of them had root canal-filled teeth. Dr. Issels insisted that they get these teeth removed before he began their cancer treatment.
         <span style="line-height: 1.5em;">
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <strong>
          Dr. Thomas Rau, M.D.
         </strong>
         is the head of the Paracelsus Cancer Clinic in Switzerland. This clinic has been one of Europes most prominent cancer treatment centers since 1957. For some 20 years, they have had, as part of their intake procedure for new patients, review of their jaws by the dental section of the clinic. Any root canal fillings are removed before any cancer treatment is started. In 2004, Dr. Rau became curious about the prevalence of root canal-filled teeth in his clinics breast cancer patients. He examined the records of the last 150 women who had been admitted to his clinic for breast cancer treatment. He found that 147 of them (98.5%) had one or more root canal-filled teeth on the same meridian (Chinese meridian system) as the original breast cancer tumor. The other three had cavitation problems (see a separate article on this subject).
         <span style="line-height: 1.5em;">
         </span>
        </li>
       </ul>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <strong>
          Dr. Robert Kulacz, D.D. S.
         </strong>
         is (was) a prominent dentist in New York. Why do I say is (was)? Because in 2002, Dr. Kulacz published, along with Dr. Thomas Levy M.D., a great book called
         <i>
          The Roots of Disease: Connecting Dentistry and Medicine.
         </i>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1401048943/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=390957&amp;creativeASIN=1401048943&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;tag=beatorg-20&amp;linkId=ZWYPTM3TFNSK23QI">
          <img alt="Roots of Disease" class="alignright wp-image-4309" height="237" src="http://beatcancer.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Roots-of-Disease.png" width="152"/>
         </a>
         It is available on Amazon.com. It is the best book Ive found on the subject of root canals and other dental toxins. Dr. Kulacz describes in detail the many people whose health he restored by freeing them of their dental toxin problems. The primary theme of the book is stated in the Introduction:
         <i>
          It is our opinion that the evidence clearly shows that many, if not most, significant diseases get their start in the dentists chair.
         </i>
         Why the is (was)? Well, you can imagine how unpopular Dr. Kulacz became with the conventional dental community after this book was published. He was harassed and threatened to the point that he had to change his name and take his family underground. He abandoned his dental practice and took up another profession.
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1401048943/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=390957&amp;creativeASIN=1401048943&amp;linkCode=as2&amp;tag=beatorg-20&amp;linkId=ZWYPTM3TFNSK23QI">
          <strong>
           Get the book
          </strong>
         </a>
         !
        </li>
       </ul>
       <ul>
        <li>
         <strong>
          Dr. Dawn Ewing, N.D.
         </strong>
         is the Executive Director of the International Academy of Biological Dentistry and Medicine (IABDM). For a list of the practitioners who belong to this organization who practice near you, go to their website,
         <a href="http://www.iabdm.org/" rel="nofollow" target="blank">
          http://www.IABDM.org
         </a>
         . Dr. Ewing has put together a 30-minute DVD describing with color pictures the most common dental toxin problems  root canal-filled teeth and cavitations.
        </li>
       </ul>
       <p>
        You can watch this video at
        <a href="http://drdawn.net/learning-center/video/" rel="nofollow" target="blank">
         http://drdawn.net/learning-center/video/
        </a>
        .
        <br/>
       </p>
       <div class="fve-video-wrapper fve-image-embed fve-thumbnail-image youtube" style="padding-bottom:75%;">
        <iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="100%" mozallowfullscreen="" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/FfVjAUfgSNs?wmode=transparent&amp;modestbranding=1&amp;autohide=1&amp;showinfo=0&amp;rel=0" webkitallowfullscreen="" width="100%">
        </iframe>
        <a class="hyperlink-image" href="//www.youtube.com/watch?v=FfVjAUfgSNs" target="_blank">
         <img src="https://img.youtube.com/vi/FfVjAUfgSNs/mqdefault.jpg"/>
         <div class="fve-play-button" style="background-image: url('http://beatcancer.org/wp-content/plugins/fluid-video-embeds/images/play.svg');">
         </div>
        </a>
       </div>
       She describes the root canal filling with an analogy. She says that if a surgeon took your smashed finger, cleaned out all the flesh and bone in it and stuffed it with straw, it would be a similarly ridiculous procedure to stuffing gutta percha in a dead piece of tooth bone in your jaw. She calls root canal fillings taxidermy.
       <p>
        Get smart folks. Dont ever let anyone you know or yourself be talked into a root canal filling by a dentist. If you have any, please get them removed properly as soon as possible. Bill Henderson, Author and Cancer Coach
        <a href="http://www.beating-cancer-gently.com/" rel="nofollow" target="blank">
         http://www.Beating-Cancer-Gently.com
        </a>
       </p>
       <div class="lr_horizontal_share" data-counter-url="http://beatcancer.org/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/" data-share-url="http://beatcancer.org/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/">
       </div>
       <div style="clear:both;">
       </div>

          <p>
           What do you do instead of getting root canals and how do you get rid of what you currently have?
          </p>
         </div>
         <a aria-label="Reply to Tracy" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=149#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-149", "149", "commentform", "2339" )'>

            <p>
             Pull out all your teeth. And if u get a cut on your arm and it gets infected, cut it off. Thats how  humans have survived, right?
            </p>
           </div>
           <a aria-label="Reply to Buddha gaut" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=1416#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-1416", "1416", "commentform", "2339" )'>

           <ol class="children">
            <li class="comment even depth-3" id="comment-28564">
             <div class="byline byline-comments">
              <span class="avatar">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a3bf084378728572b8f5b22d88241ebe?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a3bf084378728572b8f5b22d88241ebe?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
              </span>
              <span class="comment_author">
               Pine Hiker
              </span>
              <span class="comment_date">
               February 24, 2015, 10:10 am
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-28564">
              <p>
               Thats correctpull out all your teeth and then your uterus/testicles, then cut off your breasts and dont forget those ovaries ! Then well all have NO risk of getting cancer. Might as well take a hot poker and grind up all the brain matter that regulates any form of hormones and then youll be even better off. Instead of telling us that everything we do on a daily basis causes us to have some form of cancer, try telling us what were doing right ? Are we doing anything right ? When you have tooth pain and want to actually have a tooth to use for chewing/eating, then do a root canal. How else are we supposed to eat anything nutritious ? If youre okay being toothless and eating pureed foods for the rest of you life, only to say at the end of it, you didnt get cancer, go ahead. But, having experienced living with tooth pain, I am all for root canals. When I get cancer, then at least I got to eat the nutritious foods that helped strengthen me for the fight !
              </p>
             </div>
             <a aria-label="Reply to Pine Hiker" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=28564#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-28564", "28564", "commentform", "2339" )'>

         <div class="byline byline-comments">
          <span class="avatar">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/47c48b4959c852f75da87f3b216f2349?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/47c48b4959c852f75da87f3b216f2349?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </span>
          <span class="comment_author">
           cwagner@beatcancer.org
          </span>

          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-152">
          <p>
           You may contact Bill Henderson  he is a very nice man. He has a list of the right people to talk to. Please come back and give feed back on your experience. Best Wishes  Carl
          </p>
         </div>
         <a aria-label="Reply to cwagner@beatcancer.org" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=152#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-152", "152", "commentform", "2339" )'>
          Reply
         </a>
         <ol class="children">
          <li class="comment even depth-2" id="comment-2221">
           <div class="byline byline-comments">
            <span class="avatar">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/fbb41fc1d13a618424fd53e224e5b730?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/fbb41fc1d13a618424fd53e224e5b730?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </span>
            <span class="comment_author">
             greg
            </span>
            <span class="comment_date">
             August 12, 2014, 12:31 am
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-2221">
            <p>
             The whole science behind root canals is flawed. Through bad dentistry,
             <br/>
             I had a bridge that replaced a missing tooth # 30.
             <br/>
             The bridge was done incorrectly and damaged # 29. Finally got an implant
             <br/>
             for missing tooth 30 and re crowned 29. Still on and off pain
             <br/>
             Mind you this went on for a number of years. I finally let my dentist
             <br/>
             talk me in to a root canal. When they were done, the tooth still felt the
             <br/>
             same. Give it time, have the bite adj. etc. 8 weeks I still having problems.
             <br/>
             I knew she was infected. I listened to myself and articles like yours
             <br/>
             and headed straight to the oral surgeon and promptly had my tooth
             <br/>
             extracted today. The infection was in my jawbone to boot. The xrays
             <br/>
             never showed this. Not the endo or the dentist picked this up. Everyone
             <br/>
             wanted me to keep the tooth. The oral surgeon said it was a good thing
             <br/>
             I got there when I did. I saw the crap that came out of my jaw.
             <br/>
             So yes, if your tooth goes bad, the safe thing to do is pull it and
             <br/>
             get an implant. Wake up people. They are not saving your tooth, but
             <br/>
             endangering you life.
            </p>
           </div>
           <a aria-label="Reply to greg" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=2221#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-2221", "2221", "commentform", "2339" )'>
            Reply
           </a>
          </li>
          <!-- #comment-## -->
          <li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="comment-2735">
           <div class="byline byline-comments">
            <span class="avatar">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf2a2159bba11316ac52586181fe3d29?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/cf2a2159bba11316ac52586181fe3d29?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </span>
            <span class="comment_author">
             Carol
            </span>
            <span class="comment_date">
             September 9, 2014, 4:46 pm
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-2735">
            <p>
             I was recently re-diagnosed with adeno-cystic carcinoma, on my tongue.  After surgery years ago at Mayo Clinic, it was discovered they had cut into and killed a front tooth.  Root canal was strongly advised.  Pain diminished and I waited, only to find more abscess. I recently had tooth removed and antibiotics for infectionfine now.  Re-doing biopsy as this infection may have caused mis-diagnosis.  Avoid root canals and abscessed teeth  your life depends on it.
            </p>
           </div>
           <a aria-label="Reply to Carol" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=2735#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-2735", "2735", "commentform", "2339" )'>
            Reply
           </a>
          </li>

          </p>

         </a>
         <ol class="children">
          <li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="comment-877">
           <div class="byline byline-comments">

             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8bf6aed2408cc6e8f6a3881d55c1abff?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8bf6aed2408cc6e8f6a3881d55c1abff?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
            </span>
            <span class="comment_author">
             randy webb
            </span>
            <span class="comment_date">
             May 20, 2014, 1:32 am
            </span>
           </div>
           <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-877">
            <p>
             i just had a root canal done two days ago and now im quite worried
            </p>
           </div>
           <a aria-label="Reply to randy webb" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=877#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-877", "877", "commentform", "2339" )'>
            Reply
           </a>
           <ol class="children">
            <li class="comment even depth-3" id="comment-2219">
             <div class="byline byline-comments">
              <span class="avatar">
               <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/28fcff54148f340d349de7f10f555746?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/28fcff54148f340d349de7f10f555746?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
              </span>
              <span class="comment_author">
               Wong
              </span>
              <span class="comment_date">
               August 11, 2014, 3:44 am
              </span>
             </div>
             <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-2219">
              <p>
               Dont listen to any of this nonsence, i had a root canal around april and some asshole posted something like this on facebook and i was terrifyed at first but i learnt that my dentist who was the one who gave me the root canal has had them before and hes never had cancer at all, so just take it from me and dont worry about it!
              </p>
             </div>
             <a aria-label="Reply to Wong" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=2219#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-2219", "2219", "commentform", "2339" )'>
              Reply
             </a>
            </li>
            <!-- #comment-## -->

               Hello randy, no worry after root canal. Still people has fear that root canal is not option. I read one article that definitely helpful. Article is what are myths of root canal treatment.

               <a href="http://www.mitchmarderdds.com/blog/root-canal-seattle-5-myths" rel="nofollow">

        <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="comment-2273">
         <div class="byline byline-comments">
          <span class="avatar">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/d88a54ea1793aa5cd3d2fde9086a0ba6?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/d88a54ea1793aa5cd3d2fde9086a0ba6?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </span>
          <span class="comment_author">
           Desi
          </span>
          <span class="comment_date">
           August 15, 2014, 3:59 am
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-2273">
          <p>
           HEllo I am 27 have had four root canals when I was 19 and they were to straighten my teeth so the dentist had said. LOL, today all four gave out and I have had several problems because this dentist did not make sure the crown ment my gum. Tonight I have the worth pain in one of them. #Worse yet I have breast lumps that may or may not be bad(find Out soon), I started having problems less than three years after trying to straighten my sideways teeth and paid almost 4,000.00. NHow I am having all of these pulled and placing very painful implants, which will cost me 1400.00 per tooth plus another 4,000.00 for restoritive work over eight months. The dentist who did my root canals and crowns to fix my unstraight teeth told me they should last a long time,braces at 19 would have been better, the teeth were perfect other than side ways. Had one cavity before this and now my front four most important cosmetic teeth need another several thousand dollars for me to smile and my treatment plan to have the root canals removed and implants and crowns replaced is a span of eight months to one year  and almost eight grand with no problems. SKIP the root canals or have sveral opionions and have several dentist refer to the post-op root canal an prostetic.
          </p>
         </div>
         <a aria-label="Reply to Desi" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=2273#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-2273", "2273", "commentform", "2339" )'>

         </a>

        <li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1" id="comment-2763">
         <div class="byline byline-comments">
          <span class="avatar">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/dffc35ed9285d3239b6bdf2034213521?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/dffc35ed9285d3239b6bdf2034213521?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </span>
          <span class="comment_author">
           Anthony Taylor
          </span>
          <span class="comment_date">
           September 11, 2014, 5:18 pm
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-2763">
          <p>
           Im a cancer patient, multiple myeloma, I had a front right tooth to break #6 at the gum line. The tooth is very loose and hanging on by a little more than a thread of gum. I have had more than eight doses of a drug called Zometa, which is for bone strength. I have been told that Zometa is a very powerful drug that can or will cause my jaw bone not to heal properly with an extraction. Since I began to address this issue I cant find anyone will to do anything with this tooth. Im still looking for someone who will help me resolve this problem. I wont be taking any Zometa until this tooth is out. I live in hyattsville md area, I have limited resources. If anyone has suggestions it would be appreciated.
          </p>
         </div>
         <a aria-label="Reply to Anthony Taylor" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=2763#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-2763", "2763", "commentform", "2339" )'>

         </a>

        <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="comment-3234">
         <div class="byline byline-comments">
          <span class="avatar">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-50 photo" height="50" src="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2bdc359369534d8df7a9f89604908c4e?s=50&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g" srcset="http://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2bdc359369534d8df7a9f89604908c4e?s=100&amp;d=mm&amp;r=g 2x" width="50"/>
          </span>
          <span class="comment_author">
           Sandy
          </span>
          <span class="comment_date">
           October 8, 2014, 12:02 pm
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-3234">
          <p>
           This can be easier said than done. I would love to have all my root canal teeth gone! Yet I had 2 adjacent problematic (root canal) teeth removed on my upper left jaw and the question afterwords was what to do with the space that now is vacant. Implants start around $3000 per tooth and I am reluctant to spend that kind of money after all the pain and anguish I have had since 2009. Not everyone has that kind of $. Dentures are an option and I am considering a partial. I have 3 other root canals as well. I would be interested in finding out about the dentists in the article. I had a great dentist for 35 plus years. After that things went downhill and I had two dentists that told me they could help me (one guy charged $1400 for a crown-give me a break) only to make things worse.
          </p>
         </div>
         <a aria-label="Reply to Sandy" class="comment-reply-link" href="/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/?replytocom=3234#commentform" onclick='return addComment.moveForm( "comment-body-3234", "3234", "commentform", "2339" )'>

         </a>

           October 31, 2014, 4:56 am

         </div>
         <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-6995">
          <p>
           I have 4 crowns and two root canals, Three of the teeth with crowns hurt all the time. I cant eat fresh fruit because it makes my teeth so sensitive I can hardly get a toothbrush in my mouth to brush them. When I tell the dentists I just kind of get a blank stare and do help. One root canal I have had since I was 16. I will be 60 on saturday. That about 22 hours from now. It seems to be ok but I cant even remember where my other  root canal is. I wonder if it is why my whole mouth is so sensitive  though and the reason I have pain in the three crowns that gets so bad I just cant hardly stand it. A horrible ache.
          </p>
         </div>

           ngw
          </span>
          <span class="comment_date">
           November 1, 2014, 8:40 pm
          </span>
         </div>
         <div class="comment_text" id="comment-body-7605">
          <p>
           You people are delusional. If this were sound research, why havent the cancer docs made it mandatory to remove root canal treated teeth. Also, did you know that 100% of cancer patients also use toothpaste to brush their teeth. Even better, 100% of cancer patients also drink water. These type of articles prey on people that arent educated and are trying to find a quick cure for their illness. I hope they are successful in finding the cure but eliminating root canals isnt the answer.
          </p>
         </div>

          <p>
           The most common cause of all cancer is root canal-filled teeth and cavitation sites; and 2) Until a cancer patient gets rid of the root canal-filled teeth and cavitations, they dont get well  really alarming! The facts for root canal are truly amazing and think no further evidences.as the proofs shown up here are certainly justifying the topic mentioned herein; great!
          </p>

          <p>
           I dont knowbut this could be a reason in my case.
          </p>
          <p>
           I was a very healthy man, all my life.  In 2013 I had a Urethral stricture.  In order to re construct the urethral, the option was to apply a patch of buccal mucosa.
           <br/>
           3 Month later.the patch of buccal mucosatransform into Cancer.
           <br/>
           In 2013 also make a Dental Implant and 2 Root Canals.
          </p>
          <p>
           Is a link / connection between cancer and urethral stricture
          </p>

Now can someone on here give me proper advice as i think im about do die.

        </a>
       </p>
       <span class="previous_post">
        Previous:
        <a href="http://beatcancer.org/2014/03/types-of-cancer-made-simple/" rel="prev">
         Types of Cancer Made Simple
        </a>
       </span>
      </nav>
     </article>
    </section>
    <aside class="sidebar">
     <div class="widget widget_text" id="text-17">
      <div class="textwidget">
       <!-- OptinSkin -->
       <div align="center" class="ois_wrapper " data="6" data-popup-scroll="100px" id="ois_6" rel="2339" style="margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:5px;">

          <div class="ois_spi_item_3" style="color: #000 !important;">

    <div class="widget widget_text footer-bottom-content" id="text-33">
     <div class="textwidget">
      <div class="belief-statement">
       "We believe that 90% of all cancers can be eliminated through environmental &amp; lifestyle choices alone,
       <a href="http://beatcancer.org/science/">
        and science agrees
       </a>
       ."
      </div>
      <div class="footer-contact">
       <strong>
        CONTACT US
       </strong>
      </div>

   LoginRadius.util.ready(function () {
                        $i = $SS.Interface.horizontal;
                        $SS.Providers.Top = ["Facebook","Twitter","LinkedIn","GooglePlus","Pinterest","Email","Print"];
                        $u = LoginRadius.user_settings;
                        $u.sharecounttype = 'url';
                        $u.isMobileFriendly = false;
                                            $u.apikey = "6ae996e1-11e1-43b6-995a-be628532b4a6";
                                        $i.size = "32";
                        $i.show("lr_horizontal_share");
                    });
  </script>

   _stq = window._stq || [];

  <script type="text/javascript">
   jQuery(document).ready(function(){
                    var loginRadiusOptions = {};
                    loginRadiusOptions.login = true;

                    //Disabling console log messages - please delete when api has been updated
                    LoginRadius_SocialLogin.console.log = function(){};
                    
                    LoginRadius_SocialLogin.util.ready(function() {
                      $ui = LoginRadius_SocialLogin.lr_login_settings;
                      $ui.interfacesize = '';
                      $ui.apikey = "6ae996e1-11e1-43b6-995a-be628532b4a6";
                      $ui.callback = "http%3A%2F%2Fbeatcancer.org%2F2014%2F03%2Froot-canals-and-cancer%2F";
                      $ui.lrinterfacecontainer = "interfacecontainerdiv";
                      $ui.is_access_token = true;
                      $ui.lrinterfacebackground = "";                      LoginRadius_SocialLogin.init(loginRadiusOptions);
                    });
                  });
  </script>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   jQuery(document).ready(function(){
                      LoginRadiusSDK.setLoginCallback(function() {
                          var form = document.createElement('form');
                          form.action = "http://beatcancer.org/2014/03/root-canals-and-cancer/";
                          form.method = 'POST';
                          var hiddenToken = document.createElement('input');
                          hiddenToken.type = 'hidden';
                          hiddenToken.value = LoginRadiusSDK.getToken();
                          hiddenToken.name = "token";
                          form.appendChild(hiddenToken);
                          document.body.appendChild(form);
                          form.submit();
                      });
                    });
  </script>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   (function(){
	var classes = document.getElementsByClassName('menu_control');
	for (i = 0; i &lt; classes.length; i++) {
		classes[i].onclick = function() {
			var menu = this.nextElementSibling;
			if (/show_menu/.test(menu.className))
				menu.className = menu.className.replace('show_menu', '').trim();
			else
				menu.className += ' show_menu';
		};
	}
})();
  </script>
  <noscript>
   <style scoped="" type="text/css">
    .clear { display: block; }
   </style>
  </noscript>
 </body>
</html>
